meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insipid.
meanings.sent1: The insipidities of the meal made it hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't finish the book due to its insipidities.
meanings.sent3: The insipidities of the movie were so bland, it put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with insipidities that failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent5: The insipidities of the painting left me feeling empty and unimpressed.

meanings.definition: Something that is insipid or lacking in flavor or interest.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of insipidities, with dull conversations and tasteless snacks.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the insipidities of small talk at social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were insipidities that no one found amusing.
meanings.sent4: The insipidities of the routine made her yearn for excitement.
meanings.sent5: The insipidities of the music left the audience unenthused and unimpressed.
